2 /*
3  test_cx_subscriber.cpp
4  Subscribe to a single cue vector and feed it into the CX, let the
5  CX drive steering.
6 
7  Test module current state: subscribe to cue and feed into VMCX, testing
8  VMCX functionality.
9 */
10 
11 #include <ros/ros.h>
12 #include <nav_msgs/Odometry.h>
13 #include <geometry_msgs/Quaternion.h>
14 #include <geometry_msgs/Vector3.h>
15 #include <tf/transform_datatypes.h>
16 #include "std_msgs/String.h"

19 #include "bb_computation/icm.h"
20 #include "bb_computation/cue_vector.h"
21 #include "bb_computation/cx_model.hpp"
22 #include "bb_computation/vmcx_model.hpp"
23 
24 #include "bb_util/velocity.h"
25 #include "bb_util/cx_activity.h"
26 
27 
28 #define GOAL_ANGLE -2.0
29 #define TRAVERSE_TIME 30
30 
31 
32 
33 // Init CX
34 //VMCX cx;
35 CentralComplex cx;
36 
37 // Try to init VMCX;
38 //VMCX vmcx;
39 
40 // Broadcast CX status
41 ros::Publisher pub;
42 
43 // Send movement commands to the update_velocity service
44 ros::ServiceClient client;
45 
46 // Weird wee function that can help clean the linear velocity component
47 // of the odometry information. There's a little noise which could cause
48 // issues and it's more straightforward for now just to remove it.
49 // This is by no means required. Didn't use it for the yaw because I
50 // don't think there's any advantage to cleaning that up.
51 inline double clean_velocity(double lin_vel, int factor=100){
52  if (factor == 0) return 0;
53  return ((double) ((int) (lin_vel * factor))) / factor;
54 }
55 
56 //
57 // Publish for graphing
58 //
59 void cx_status_publish(std::vector<std::vector<double>> &status){
60  bb_util::cx_activity msg;
61 
62  msg.tl2 = status[0];
63  msg.cl1 = status[1];
64  msg.tb1 = status[2];
65  msg.cpu4 = status[3];
66  msg.mem = status[4];
67  msg.cpu1 = status[5];
68 
69  pub.publish(msg);
70 }
71 
72 //
73 // Cue callback
74 //
75 void cvCallback(const bb_computation::cue_vector::ConstPtr& cue_msg){
76  ROS_INFO("Cue info: (R: %f, T: %f)",
77  cue_msg->magnitude,
78  cue_msg->theta);
79  //
80  // Msg unpack
81  //
82  float current = cue_msg->theta;
83  float error = GOAL_ANGLE - current;
84  float correction_velocity = -0.09*error;
85 
86  // Get motor output from CX
87  double CXMotor = cx.unimodal_monolithic_CX(current, 10);
88 
89  // Get status
90  std::vector<std::vector<double>> cx_status;
91  cx.get_status(cx_status);
92  cx_status_publish(cx_status);
93 
94  //
95  // Velocity update
96  //
97  bb_util::velocity msg;
98  msg.request.angular = correction_velocity;
99  msg.request.linear = 0.0;
100  client.call(msg);
101 }
102 
103 void odomCallback(const nav_msgs::Odometry::ConstPtr& odom_msg){
104  // odom.twist.linear.x // Linear velocity or forward speed
105  // odom.pose.orientation.z // Heading - quaternion comes into play
106 
107  // Conversion from Quaternion to RPY, lifted from ROS forums.
108  tf::Quaternion quat;
109  tf::quaternionMsgToTF(odom_msg->pose.pose.orientation, quat);
110 
111  double roll, pitch, yaw;
112  tf::Matrix3x3(quat).getRPY(roll, pitch, yaw);
113 
114  double linear_velocity = clean_velocity(odom_msg->twist.twist.linear.x);
115  double CXMotor = cx.unimodal_monolithic_CX(yaw, linear_velocity);
116 
117  ROS_INFO("[CXMOTOR] : [%f]", CXMotor);
118 
119  // Get status
120  std::vector<std::vector<double>> cx_status;
121  cx.get_status(cx_status);
122  cx_status_publish(cx_status);
123 
124  // Update velocity
125  bb_util::velocity msg;
126 
128  // DONT RUN THIS ON THE ROBOT; YOU WILL BREAK THE MOTORS //
130  msg.request.angular = (CXMotor < 0) ? 0.5 : -0.5;
131  msg.request.linear = 0.05;
132  client.call(msg);
134  // DONT RUN THIS ON THE ROBOT; YOU WILL BREAK THE MOTORS //
136 }
137 
138 int main(int argc, char **argv){
139  ros::init(argc, argv, "test_cx_subscriber");
140  ros::NodeHandle n;
141 
142  // ROS networking
143  // Get cue - Sub to visual cues
144  //ros::Subscriber sub = n.subscribe("visual_cue", 1000, cvCallback);
145 
146  // Sub to odometry for internal compass info
147  ros::Subscriber sub = n.subscribe("odom", 1000, odomCallback);
148 
149  // Request velocity changes from velocity service
150  client = n.serviceClient<bb_util::velocity>("update_velocity");
151 
152  // Set up publisher for CX
153  pub = n.advertise<bb_util::cx_activity>("cx_status", 1);
154 
155  ROS_INFO("Running...");
156 
157  ros::spin();
158 
159  return 0;
160 }
